sect2.title: Configuring OpenLDAP
sect2.para: The only configuration needed for OpenLDAP is to run ldconfig. The LDAP server can be started by /usr/sbin/slapd as described in the man page slapd(8).
Data can be added to the LDAP database via ldapadd. There are other programs that can use the database. For more information see the appropriate man page.
